intro: Roupala ovata, commonly known as the oval roupala, is a small evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and elliptical leaves that are dark green on top and pale underneath. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, followed by orange-red berries that are edible but often have a bitter taste. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade.
